intro: Kalanchoe crenata var. collina, commonly known as the scalloped kalanchoe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, thick leaves with a scalloped edge, often tinged with red or purple along the margins. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect sunlight. Kalanchoe crenata var. collina is drought-tolerant and suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant.
